CompensationCompetitive salaryPerformance-based bonus & promotion pathFlexible benefitsCareer-defining growth investment: we spent over $100,000 on team development last year ‚Äì executive coaching, certifications, and training that accelerates your career beyond any traditional path
Our MissionThe legal industry is broken ‚Äì outdated, overpriced, and structurally rigged against innovation and access. Today, 92% of low-income households can‚Äôt afford legal help, and meaningful reform is blocked by laws that prohibit non-lawyers from owning or operating law firms.This shuts out entrepreneurs and business leaders who drive real change. At the same time, firms are confined by state-level regulations that make it hard to scale across jurisdictions, limiting competition and protecting inefficiency. While other industries have embraced technology, law firms are still stuck in the past ‚Äì reliant on paper, billable hours, and outdated systems.Our mission is to change that. By equipping law firms with cutting-edge tech and world-class operations, we will push the industry 10 years forward ‚Äì delivering faster, better, and more affordable legal services at scale.
Swans Core ValuesValue alignment is non-negotiable. Because of the close collaboration with the founding team and the direct impact on clients, it's essential that you genuinely connect with and embody our commitment to Care. Our standards are high - historically, only 3% of candidates possess the rare combination of technical aptitude, problem-solving skills, and cultural alignment we require.Care for Ourselves: We push ourselves to grow every day. We take full responsibility for our lives and choices. That means taking care of our mental, physical, and emotional health so we can consistently show up at our best. If we‚Äôre not growing, we‚Äôre falling behind.Care for Our Team: We work as one team. No internal competition, no egos. We help each other win and give honest feedback when something‚Äôs off. We check in, offer help before it‚Äôs asked for, and never let a teammate struggle alone. If one of us fails, we all do. If one of us wins, we all benefit. When someone needs something, do it better and faster than expected.Care for Our Clients: We focus on real outcomes, not just fulfilling requests. Clients trust us to solve the right problems, not just follow instructions. That means delivering practical, effective solutions that actually move the needle. It also means managing relationships with clear communication and follow-through.Care for Swans: Swans exists because a group of people believed in the vision and put skin in the game. For this to work long-term, we need to protect and grow the company. That means putting Swans first when it matters. When the company wins, we all win. That includes making sure our early backers see the return they deserve.Care for Our World: Low-income households receive no or inadequate legal help for 92% of their legal problems. This gap leaves millions navigating critical issues like housing, healthcare, and family matters without the support they need. We are on a mission to create a more just and equitable society by making legal services accessible across all income levels.

Job title: Wallet Operation Specialist

Location: Paris, France

About Ledger

We‚Äôre a team of experts pushing the limits of what‚Äôs possible, united by our common goal to unlock true freedom through digital ownership, making technology accessible for all. We believe in a world where users, creators and enterprises manage their value with ownership and freedom. Our curiosity drives us to innovate, empowering individuals on a global scale. We believe change is constant and our team moves forward as one, with a culture of problem-solving where every employee is empowered and supported to challenge tradition and create solutions. Our mission is simple: to make self-custody accessible and give people the keys to their own financial futures. If you want to make a true impact, we want you to join us at Ledger.

At Ledger, we‚Äôre proud to be the global platform for digital assets and Web3, with over 20% of the world‚Äôs crypto assets secured through our Ledger devices. With our headquarters in Paris, and offices in Vierzon, Grenoble, Montpellier, London, Portland, Geneva, Zurich and Central Singapore, we have a team of around 600 professionals developing a variety of products and services to enable individuals and companies to securely buy, store, swap, grow and manage crypto assets ‚Äì including the Ledger hardware wallets line with more than 7.5 millions units already sold in 200 countries.

The Team

The Wallet Operations and Optimization Team is responsible for looking at the ongoing performance and experience quality of the Ledger Wallet (the application itself and its services) from the point of view of the end Consumer and the point of View of the Providers delivering the Ledger Wallet services. In order to complete this task, the team will build, observe and monitor a broad set of internal, external and customer related indicators, KPIs and dashboards as well as directly observe the Wallet experience. Based on procedures the team will look for and investigate potential issues, alert, when relevant directly remedy some situations especially partner related, as well as reach out to other internal groups and external partners in order for them to take action. The team is equally a resource for other teams in order to clarify issues and take actions within their remit.

The team will actively contribute to delivering the best possible consumer and partner experience of the current version of the Wallet, contribute to identifying optimisation and ultimately impact consumers and partners satisfaction, engagement, NPS, and Ledger revenue.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

As a specialist in the team, you perform the key tasks described in the mission. In particular, you will interface directly with various service providers, stakeholders, support and account management, and a large number of key teams in the Ledger organization, in particular within customer success, business line management and technology. Keeping the interest of the consumers and service providers in mind, you will demonstrate a high degree of curiosity and initiative in identifying issues while staying within the agreed roles and procedures in the resolution.

Proven experience (2+ years) in a technical customer success, partner/account management, or incident management role.Experience assimilating and reviewing data from monitoring and alerting tools (e.g., Datadog, Tableau, Mixpanel).Ability to build strong relationships with partners while staying objective and enforcing agreed standards.Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills and the ability to work under pressure.Strong process management skills and technical literacy, with experience in top-level support for businesses in the tech or blockchain industry.Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, with a "Customer-First" attitude.A genuine interest in cryptocurrencies and/or blockchain environments.


Bonus Points

Knowledge of ITIL or other incident management frameworks.ITIL, SRE, or similar operational certifications.


Benefits

At Ledger, we are dedicated to continually investing in our employees which is why we offer more than just salaries; we provide comprehensive compensation packages that include a wide range of benefits. Here are some of the benefits you can look forward to:

Flexible work options - Our hybrid policy allows employees to work from home up to 3 times per weekHealth & Wellness support - Health and Life Insurance.Financial growth opportunities - Employees can become shareholders in Ledger as well as other financial benefits depending on your country of work.Commuter allowance - Ledger offers a commuter allowance to contribute to your preferred means of transportation.Learning & Development - A comprehensive suite of training solutions providing a personalised learning experience for every employee.


For regionally specific benefits, your Talent Acquisition contact will be able to provide you with more information.

jobs.description:

Our Vision, Mission & Success are fuelled by our commitment to be a driving force of positive change to the health of everyday consumers, providing conscious, high-quality & innovative supplement products.

Your Next RoleWe are looking for a proactive, detail-oriented and data-obsessed Email Marketing Associate with at least 3 years of experience to join our fast-growing team. Your primary focus will be to help drive customer retention, revenue growth, and brand loyalty through highly effective email and SMS marketing.
You? You're totally obsessed with building smart automations, building converting lists, slicing up clean segments, protecting deliverability, ensuring flawless execution from technical setup to post-send data analysis. and turning data into winning campaigns and flows. You're fluent in Klaviyo, can set up rock-solid flows and campaigns, and know how to make data-driven decisions that drive revenue and growth.
If that's you, read on. üëá
You'll work closely with our retention manager, copywriters, and designers to bring emails and texts to life and continuously optimize performance through data-driven A/B testing.And, also collaborate with cross-functional teams across SMS, direct mail, product, business development, marketplace and analytics to ensure a cohesive customer journey and consistent messaging. The ideal candidate has a passion for email marketing, thrives in a fast-paced environment, and combines technical precision with strategic thinking.
What You'll Do
Klaviyo Flow Setup & Management‚Ä¢ Co-develop customer journey map with retention manager and translate the plan into emails, SMS, and DM flows‚Ä¢ Specify flow filters, triggers, conditional splits, target audience, and Klaviyo settings essential to deliver the optimal impact for the flows‚Ä¢ Implement advanced automation and segmentation strategies for acquisition and retention ‚Äî including onboarding, replenishment, cross-sells, winbacks, abandons, and new offer/message tests.‚Ä¢ Map out flow logic to ensure the right messages reach the right customers at the right time, minimizing overlap and communication fatigue.‚Ä¢ Maintain and improve existing flows, auditing performance and proposing adjustments based on data insights.‚Ä¢ Document all flow structures and logic for team visibility and future reference.‚Ä¢ Identify opportunities to personalize flow content based on customer behavior, purchase history, and engagement signals.‚Ä¢ Collaborate with creative and copy teams to ensure flow content aligns with brand voice and customer journey goals.‚Ä¢ Test all new flows rigorously to confirm technical accuracy, proper audience targeting, and optimal deliverability.‚Ä¢ Monitor flow performance post-launch and proactively troubleshoot any issues (e.g. errors in triggers, audience misalignment, drops in engagement).‚Ä¢ Review and test every flow to check for typos, grammatical errors, layout issues, optimizations across mobile and desktop; and to ensure correct segmentation, logic, links, formatting, and deliverability.‚Ä¢ Monitor performance immediately after launch and again at the 24-hour, 48-hour, 1 week mark to catch and fix any issues fast.
Campaign Strategy & Development‚Ä¢ Manage the end-to-end execution of one-time and recurring email campaigns (including set up and QA for typos, grammatical errors, layout issues, optimizations across mobile and desktop, correct links, correct segments), ensuring they align with overarching marketing and retention strategies.‚Ä¢ Help Build and maintain a content calendar/strategy to support promotional, evergreen, and seasonal campaigns to meet retention, acquisition, email, and SMS KPIs‚Ä¢ Collaborate with copywriters and designers to create compelling conversion-centric email creative and email templates that meets production deadlines and maintain brand quality.‚Ä¢ Segment and target audiences for campaigns using behavioral, transactional, and demographic data.‚Ä¢ Configure all technical elements of campaigns in Klaviyo, including sending profiles, timing, throttling, and exclusion logic.‚Ä¢ Analyze campaign results and prepare actionable reports to inform future strategy and optimizations.‚Ä¢ Keep documentation up-to-date for campaign processes, templates, and learnings to improve efficiency and team knowledge sharing.‚Ä¢ Explore new Klaviyo features and tools that could enhance campaign capabilities and effectiveness.‚Ä¢ Monitor performance immediately after launch and again at the 24-hour, 48-hour, 1 week mark to catch and fix any issues fast.
Klaviyo List, Segment, Filter, and Tag Management‚Ä¢ Manage segmentation, tagging, deliverability management, and account structure hygiene inside Klaviyo.‚Ä¢ Assess, optimize, and build segments for targeting offers, product launches, and email/sms optimizations based on RFM, customer behavior, lifecycle stage, engagement, and other variables.‚Ä¢ Design and optimize pop-ups and zero-party data capture (e.g. quizzes, gated content) to grow the email list and fuel personalized segmentation and messaging.‚Ä¢ A/B split test pop ups to optimize list growth‚Ä¢ Help design and optimize lead nurturing and conversion sequences that move subscribers into buyers ‚Äî and buyers into loyalists.‚Ä¢ Maintain a clean, scalable list structure with consistent tagging and naming conventions.
Deliverability Optimization‚Ä¢ Familiarize and optimize email deliverability architecture (eg. key kpis to improve deliverability and inbox placement, SPF/DKIM/DMARC configurations, ESP updates).‚Ä¢ Protect and strengthen our email deliverability by monitoring key metrics and following best practices (SPF, DKIM, DMARC setups/updates, Glockapp tests, Google Postmaster and engagement monitoring).‚Ä¢ Design mini-projects to continually improve sender reputation and inbox placement prioritizing based on highest impact.‚Ä¢ Quickly troubleshoot bounce rate spikes, spam complaints, or other deliverability red flags.
Measurement and A/B Testing‚Ä¢ Report daily, weekly, and monthly on campaign and flow performance ‚Äî focusing on key revenue, engagement, deliverability metrics plus lift, not just vanity metrics.‚Ä¢ Run continuous A/B tests on subject lines, segmentation tactics, offer framing, timing, and design elements.‚Ä¢ Work closely with the measurement team to build reports using Google Data Studio and our data warehouse, or similar.‚Ä¢ Analyze and present clear insights from performance trends to guide future strategies.‚Ä¢ Continuously measure and optimize the performance of initiatives while assessing data and culling strategic insights to lead email and SMS projects‚Ä¢ Demonstrate working knowledge of attribution methodology eg. first click, last click.
Project Management‚Ä¢ Collaborate with internal teams across product, marketplace, operations, customer service, influencer, data, and growth departments‚Ä¢ Work closely with copywriter, designer, freelancers, and colleagues to meet quality standards and content production timelines working with a minimum 2 week buffer‚Ä¢ Project coordinate copywriting and design using proper tags and labels with direction from retention manager.
External Stakeholder Management‚Ä¢ Collaborate with ad agency to review and approve project roadmaps, flow charts, flow content, reports, and design‚Ä¢ Work with Klaviyo and Recart vendors to optimize campaigns, flows, pop ups, segments, and deliverability‚Ä¢ Provide deliverables to Recart, such as, copy, MMS, approved campaign schedules, flow content.
Invoice Management‚Ä¢ Compile and review email and SMS invoices to ensure accuracy‚Ä¢ Submit invoices for approval and follow up to ensure timely payments
Who You Are‚Ä¢ 3-5 years of direct, hands-on email marketing experience, ideally for DTC or eCommerce brands.‚Ä¢ Deep Klaviyo expertise ‚Äî including flows, campaigns, segmentation, tagging, and reporting.‚Ä¢ Strong project management skills ‚Äî you know how to juggle timelines, people, and moving pieces without dropping the ball.‚Ä¢ Excellent QA skills ‚Äî attention to detail is your superpower.‚Ä¢ Analytical mindset ‚Äî you love digging into data and finding actionable trends, not just reporting numbers.‚Ä¢ Strong grasp of direct response marketing principles (awareness, market sophistication, persuasion, objection handling, hooks and leads).‚Ä¢ Proven experience designing, executing, and iterating on A/B tests.‚Ä¢ Understanding of deliverability fundamentals and best practices.‚Ä¢ Comfort working cross-functionally with copy, creative, retention, and analytics teams.‚Ä¢ Ability to thrive in a fast-paced ambiguous environment where priorities can shift quickly‚Ä¢ Proactive: can take initiative and problem-solve‚Ä¢ Clear, respectful, and prompt communication with internal teams and external vendors‚Ä¢ Detail-oriented ‚Äî details in flows, accuracy in invoices, and quality in content are important to you‚Ä¢ Growth mindset, adaptable, open to feedback, and driven to continuously improve how things are done‚Ä¢ Strong "builder" desire - we built our brand to 9 figures in revenue profitably with ~30 full-time employees and this would not have happened without a strong work ethic and a mission-driven culture. We aim to build the brand to 10 figures by the end of the decade, and this requires a strong sense of commitment to build something together with like-minded people.‚Ä¢ Bonus: Basic Figma, HTML, or copywriting skills.

About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

This position is Paris-based, with relocation support available.

Team

You will be an integral part of a newly established internal studio, a dynamic and focused team dedicated to one of our most promising prototype in scale. This studio is specifically chartered to improve this high-potential game up to the successful and market-ready title it is meant to become.
